ygData.subject: Re: Re: Lots o Wizard groups
ygData.msgSnippet: ... This is probably a bit off topic, but since you asked... I used Denon s Disrupted Discord(18th), Chord s of Dissonance(2nd), and Hymn of Restoration(6th).
ygData.messageBody:
On Fri, 8 Oct 1999, Dave Gaines wrote:

> From: Dave Gaines <dave@...>
>
> Ok, my bard can pull rather well, but occassionally that spell gets resisted
> and the only option is to zone unless the party can take on more than 1.
> It is a bit faster to pull with a bard than a monk.
>
> My question is what songs did you twist when you fought the paladin? How
> did you play this fight?
>

This is probably a bit off topic, but since you asked...

I used Denon's Disrupted Discord(18th), Chord's of Dissonance(2nd), and
Hymn of Restoration(6th). I used those 3 songs with switching instruments
and punches (1-4dmg :) After 18th bards are more powerful using just
music. Had I tried fighting the paladin with my PGT and barbed whip, I
would have been thumped soundly. The problem is those songs are area
effect. You wouldn't believe the hatred mobs feel for bards, but thats a
rant for another list.

As for bards pulling, all the songs are low level ones as already posted.
In fact only a handful of bard songs over 20 are any good, which is why I
dont play him much these days.


-Bethorn
